main event: An oval-shaped object was observed at 1800 hours on June 11, 1962, flying in a constant northwest direction.
interesting points: The object was tracked by aircraft intercept radar before being visually acquired.,Two pilots observed the object, describing it as roughly oval and silver in color.,One pilot compared the object's size to a dime held at arm's length.,The sighting lasted approximately 2 minutes.,The object was a single entity observed flying at a specific bearing.
